issues.description: The attributes numberOfInscribedStudents and numberOfGuestStudents are specified as type double in the UML diagram of the problem statement, but they are implemented as type int in the solution repository. This discrepancy could confuse students who follow the UML diagram, leading to inconsistencies when comparing their implementation against the solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the solution repository to declare numberOfInscribedStudents and numberOfGuestStudents as double to align with the UML diagram in the problem statement, ensuring students have a consistent reference for attribute types.

issues.description: The constructor in the solution repository uses int parameters for numberOfInscribedStudents and numberOfGuestStudents, which conflicts with the UML diagram in the problem statement that implies these should be double based on attribute types. This could mislead students into using incorrect types when implementing the constructor as specified.
issues.suggested_fix: Modify the constructor parameters in the solution repository to use double for numberOfInscribedStudents and numberOfGuestStudents to match the types described in the UML diagram, promoting accurate student implementation.
